title: Peter Boettke on Katrina and the Economics of Disaster
description: Pete Boettke of George Mason University talks about the role of government and voluntary efforts in relieving suffering during and after a crisis such as Katrina. Drawing on field research he is directing into the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina, Boettke highlights the role of what he calls "civil society"--the informal, voluntary associations we make as individuals with each other to create community.
author: webmaster@econlib.org (Library of Economics and Liberty)
